cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking generally west, then turning WSW toward the south-central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the south Texas coast between Baffin Bay and Mesquite Bay (near or just south of Corpus Christi)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect – all upgraded to warnings
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Baffin Bay to Mesquite Bay TX; Storm-Surge Warning: Baffin Bay to Sargent TX (includes Corpus Christi Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and central Texas coast from the mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass, including Corpus Christi Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely; brief period of hurricane-force gusts possible during landfall Saturday afternoon/evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible in Corpus Christi Bay and adjacent inlets, peaking around the time of landfall/high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated totals to 15 inches possible, producing flash flooding and rapid rises on small streams and rivers.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; brief tornadoes possible overnight into Saturday.
